title: [file format] .smi on OSX
content:
Hello, I have some works stored in a `.smi` “self mounting image” disk created on MacOS 9.  
I have the old Disk Copy 6.33 classic application, but I can’t open the file.  
I don’t have access to a machine running MacOS 9.  
Could you please hint me at one OSX utility that does this job ?  
Thank you.

 [‹ Problem with overlap in new script font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071115063308/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38687 "Go to previous forum topic") [Custom Type Specimen ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071115063308/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38654 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Alessandro Segalini

comments.content: Either the Disk Utility application that comes with OS X or Stuffit Expander should be able to open it, if it can’t launch on its own.
It is possible the file may be corrupt if you’re getting that kind of error. There may be a solution but someone more expert than I will have to reveal it to you.
